name: Math League — Full Redesign
complexityNotes: 7-page static site with registration pathways, competition catalog with anchor navigation, pricing tables, FAQ accordions, and external e-commerce integration (e-junkie). Mobile-first responsive with WCAG AA accessibility. No auth, no CMS, no database.

organization.name: Mathematics Leagues, Inc.
organization.nonprofitNotes: Not found in ProPublica's 501(c)(3) database. Entity is 'Mathematics Leagues, Inc.' — charges for contests, sells books, and runs paid summer programs. No donation page or tax-exempt language on site.

audience.reachNotes: Per mathleague.com: 'Over one million students from the United States and Canada participate in Math League Contests each year.' This makes it the largest math competition in North America by participation (compare AMC ~300K, MATHCOUNTS ~100K).
audience.internationalNotes: Summer tournament draws ~250 students from 6+ countries. Online Summer Challenge is open worldwide. Separate Asia registration via INFO@LTHOUGHTS.COM.

trafficAssessment.participationBasis: 1,000,000+ annual student participants across US and Canada
webIndicators: Monthly contest result postings drive recurring traffic (6 HS contests/year + grade school results)
trafficAssessment.competitiveContext: Largest K-12 math competition in North America. Significantly larger than AMC (~300K students), MATHCOUNTS (~100K), and Math Olympiad for Elementary (~170K).

portfolio.shortDescription: Complete 7-page redesign for the largest K-12 math competition in North America (1M+ annual participants).
portfolio.longDescription: Full redesign of mathleague.com featuring mobile-first layout, WCAG AA accessibility, three registration pathways, competition catalog with sticky navigation, pricing tables, FAQ system, and e-commerce integration. Built with Tailwind CSS and vanilla JS — no build step required.
